alert.note: Alert for Castro; Lamb; Parmer (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 6:14PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Parmer, southwestern Castro and north central Lamb Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 614 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Lazbuddie, or 10 miles northwest of Earth, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Parmer, southwestern Castro and north central Lamb Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
